extendedInfo.description: Get anonymous, objective feedback on your ketamine use and compare yourself to thousands of other people around the world.drugs meter knows it not just about how much ketamine you take â itâs how much you take, how you take it, who you are and what else is going on in your life.This quick, anonymous quiz assesses your ketamine habits and adjust the results based on your medical and family history - to give you a more accurate assessment of how ketamine is affecting your life.So if you want to know how your ketamine  use compares to other people, what chemical reaction happens when you take ketamine and alcohol together, or are just want tips on staying safe - check out the ketamine drugs meter to see how you measure up.Features -â¢Immediate, anonymous feedback on your ketamine useâ¢Compare your use with other peopleâs ketamine habits worldwideâ¢Work out how you use and how much you spendâ¢Adjustment for different ways of taking ketamineâ¢Photos of lines to calculate the size of your average line/dose in gramsâ¢Adjusted ketamine consumption based on your medical and family historyâ¢Drug associated problem score quiz to assess how ketamine is impacting on your lifeâ¢Tips for the future and advice on cutting downâ¢Safer snorting tipsâ¢ketamine laws (UK only at present)â¢ketamine and drivingâ¢ketamine and safer sex â specific to gender and sexualityketamine drugs meter was developed by Dr Adam R Winstock MBBS, BSc, MSc, MD, MRCP, MRCPsych â a Consultant Psychiatrist and Addiction Medicine Specialist based in the UK.NotesAll information you submit to drugs meter is unidentifiable and untraceable.drugs meter stores the anonymous data from all submissions and compiles an ever-growing database which future results are then compared to, to build a picture of how people are using drugs around the world.drugs meter isnât funded by any government or other organisation and is committed to giving honest, accurate information.
